intro: Saracha weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's saracha, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Saracha weberbaueri is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
